name: Vegan Diwani Handi Vegetables
description: Learn how to make restaurant-style Diwani Handi Vegetables at home with this easy handi veg recipe. Mixed vegetables and cashew nuts simmered in a rich tomato-based gravy. Gluten-free & soy-free, nut-free option.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 teaspoon paprika (Or Kashmiri red chili powder )
1/4 cup non-dairy yogurt or use any non-dairy cream of choice
1/2 cup  tomato puree or unseasoned tomato sauce about 4 ounces
3 tablespoons raw cashews (you can also use roasted unsalted cashews)
1/2 to 1 cup of other vegetables of choice
cilantro and lemon juice for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Make the sauce: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Once the oil is really hot, add in the cumin seeds and bay leaves and cook until the cumin seeds are very fragrant.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the sauce: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Once the oil is really hot, add in the cumin seeds and bay leaves and cook until the cumin seeds are very fragrant.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add in onion, a pinch of salt, and mix well and cook for 2 minutes then add in the ginger and chili and mix well and continue to cook until the onion is nearly golden brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Then add in onion, a pinch of salt, and mix well and cook for 2 minutes then add in the ginger and chili and mix well and continue to cook until the onion is nearly golden brown.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the paprika, ground coriander, and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the paprika, ground coriander, and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add in yogurt and the tomato puree and salt and mix well. Bring to a good boil then add in the water. Mix well and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Then add in yogurt and the tomato puree and salt and mix well. Bring to a good boil then add in the water. Mix well and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: To make the vegetables: heat another skillet over medium-high heat. Add in 1 teaspoon of oil. Once hot, add in the garlic cloves, fenugreek leaves, and mix. Then cook until the garlic is just starting to turn golden.
recipeInstructions.name: To make the vegetables: heat another skillet over medium-high heat. Add in 1 teaspoon of oil. Once hot, add in the garlic cloves, fenugreek leaves, and mix. Then cook until the garlic is just starting to turn golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Then quickly add in the ground cumin and cashews and mix well. Cook until the cashews start to turn golden. You want to stir frequently so that the garlic doesn't burn.
recipeInstructions.name: Then quickly add in the ground cumin and cashews and mix well. Cook until the cashews start to turn golden. You want to stir frequently so that the garlic doesn't burn.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the cauliflower, carrots, potatoes, and vegetables, and salt and mix well. Toss well to coat. Cook uncovered for 4-5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the cauliflower, carrots, potatoes, and vegetables, and salt and mix well. Toss well to coat. Cook uncovered for 4-5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir occasionally then cover the skillet, Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook until the vegetables are just about done.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir occasionally then cover the skillet, Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook until the vegetables are just about done.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the sauce and mix well. Bring it to a boil. Taste and adjust salt and flavor. If you want saucier dish then add in  1/2 to 1 cup of non-dairy milk and bring to a boil then take off heat. Add quick cooking veggies if using, such as peas now.

recipeInstructions.text: Taste and adjust flavor. Fish out the bag leaves. Top with cilantro, pepper flakes if you like, and lemon juice, and serve with roti, naan , or rice.
